Name: Statue of Amenhotep the Third
Description: King Amenhotep the Third wears the Blue Crown associated with ceremonies and warrior kings. This statue shows Amenhotep the Third's distinctive facial features including large almond-shaped eyes, arched eyebrows, full cheeks, and fleshy lips. A uraeus, or royal cobra, was once attached to the hole on his forehead. Hieroglyphics on the base of the statue list the king's royal names and titles.
